name: O diabo no meio do redemoinho
description: Afro-Brazilian religions believe that Exu / Phambu Njila is the path, or is linked to the paths. Sometimes referred to as the devil, it is (indeed) the protector of our ways. The Sertão, the Brazilian interior, is a path in itself, a gateway to another world, another Brasil. There, the devil is a crossroad between a street and a whirlwind, as Guimarães Rosa (psycho)graphed, in Grande Sertão: Veredas. Overlay and composition of photos, drawing and collage by Pedro Surubim, jpeg. April, 2021.
